result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon K Boyden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • County Retail Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:10 AM case called and held via Zoom. Defendant Brandon K Boyden appeared by video.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Brandon K Boyden.  Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. State moves to amend to a county ordinance for retail theft. Court accepts motion and defendant enters a No Contest plea to the amended count. Court accepts plea, finds the defendant Guilty and orders court costs only.
